result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Thomas W Krueger

defendant.name: Krueger, Thomas W

records.addlTxt: Telephone scheduling conference on November 11, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Telephone scheduling conference on September 20, 2022 at 09:15 am.

8:31 AM Prosecuting attorney Yolanda J. Tienstra in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Thomas W Krueger in court.  Attorney Steven John Luchsinger in court for Thomas W Krueger. Waiver of Preliminary Hearing filed. Court reviews; accepts wavier and binds over to Br 3; proceeds to Arraignment. DA files Information. Review of info is waived; not guilty plea entered; 20 days mtns; tsc set; bail con't

Adjustment Number: 22A 068086,
Payable Number: 243572,
Receipt Number: 22R 010925,
Amount: $20.00

8:05 AM Intern Marco Lewis w/ADA Pack for State. Def FTA. Message received; Atty Luchsinger retained, will be filing Retainer. Discussion held. Court adjourns to next week at 8:15 to verify Retainer is filed; leaves on calendar as scheduled.
Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.

1:02 PM Intern Marco Lewis w/Prosecuting attorney Gilbert Grant Thompson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Thomas W Krueger appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Teri Strohschein (eligibility TBD) appeared by video for Thomas W Krueger. Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested, waiving time limits. Prelim & Review set. Court sets $1000 PA bond with conditions: Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Review hearing scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 08:15 am.
